reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A group that my husband belongs to had regularly used this hotel and I always tag along because it is so close to the malls. The rooms are clean, staff attentive and location good. We attended a banquet on Saturday night and everything was good. We will be attending a function in February and we have already booked our room. Thanks for a good time.
reviews.title: We keep going back!!!

reviews.text: This hotel reminded me of the old drive up motels you would see along RT 66. While it was clean and the staff were friendly, I would consider looking at another hotel. Getting to this hotel can be tricky due to the divided highway.
reviews.title: Ok, but it reminds me of an old drive up motel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved a room at this hotel using a discount hotel website. We had specifically requested a refrigerator for the room during the booking process, as well as asked for it on check-in. After we had been in the room an hour - still no fridge. Called the front desk to check about it (we were beginning a road trip and were trying to save money by carrying our own food) and it took another 20 minutes. The person who actually brought it was friendly, helpful, and polite though.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious, although somewhat outdated in style and bathroom fixtures (we were on the "motel" looking side of the building).
reviews.title: Three Night Stay in Sept 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym facilities were not as I had hoped; the website was not specific about what was offered, and it was only a few cardio machines in a cramped small room that you needed a separate key for. Fortunately, I had gear in my car and ample space in the bedroom to do what I needed!
reviews.title: Clean and great location

reviews.text: Second time staying here, it's a great location, easy highway access and to the downtown via Regent Street (if the traffic isn't bad). Price has been my major deciding factor when picking Fredericton Inn, it's hard to beat. The rooms are a bit older, the plumbing specifically could use some upgrades (noisy, but there is hot water). The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept in. I will probably stay here again if the need to get a hotel arises again.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Clean, Convenient

reviews.text: Our stay with this hotel can only be described in one word - excellent. The staff were always helpful, polite, and good-natured. The food provided for the reunion and other meals eaten at the restaurants was perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to this city.
reviews.title: Visited from Morinville, Alberta

reviews.text: Spent 3 days with a group of people at a Airforce Reunion. We found the staff of the Inn very accomidating and friendly. We had a room near back parking lot, it was quiet, clean and very comfortable. We ate at the cafe and the food was very good. The price was good, and would stay here again. Enjoyed my time at the Inn and in New Brunswick.
reviews.title: Visited from Etobicoke

reviews.text: We would not recommend this hotel. Don't get fooled by the pictures on the site, they look nicer than they really are. The first night we would've walked out. We were put on the lower level. When we first walked in the hallway, it was stinky. The room we had was #105, thank god there was no live wire on the floor because the carpet was soaked and the smell of dampness was so bad . They changed us to room # 116 which was no better. There was mildew on the window, the bathroom floor stayed wet, even the beddings were damp. The rooms and furniture really need renovations and upgrades. We asked for a cot bed . It was only good for the dump because it was falling apart.We were still charged full price which was too much for what it was worth. First and last time there,,,,, all I can say!!!!!!
reviews.title: Very expensive for what it's worth...

reviews.text: The Fredericton Inn has a number of things going for it, namely the fact that there is plenty of convention space which allows for multiple events, supported by 200 guest rooms. The hotel is frequently used by small trade shows and business conventions. In addition, the hotel is adjacent to several shopping malls and fast food spots. Take away its convention/meeting space and put this hotel on the outskirt of town, you have a hotel that is outdated and just slightly above acceptable rates. Now don't get me wrong, the hotel is very well kept and clean, it just lacks the upgrades and trendy decor that would pull it out of the 1990s. Even the onsite restaurant seems to be a time piece from decades ago. In terms of my stay: there was plenty of hot water and water pressure; the bed was comfortable but not fabulous; room temperature was good with great ventilation (no typical hotel stuffiness); there are plenty of WiFi spots and in room internet; the staff was pleasant and helpful. I would have no problem returning to the hotel as long as the rate remained acceptable.
reviews.title: Average Hotel in a Good Location

reviews.text: I found that this Hotel was quite accomodating. I was given a room that I had requested while booking. The staff was very friendly. There was some tournaments going on in the city the same night I was there so there were a lot of kids running up and down the halls but their parents had them quieted down around 11:30pm. It was nice seeing the kids and the parents together for these events and the kids were having a grand time. I also liked the fact that this hotel does accomodate animals as well. A VERY GOOD feature in my books. I would reccomend this hotel to my friends.
reviews.title: OVERNIGHT STAY

reviews.text: This is an average hotel at best. My welcoming comment by the front desk staff member was “fill this card in with your personal details”. On my walk to the room I noted dirty “room service” plates on the hallway floor and a few random, partially eaten, chicken wings scattered down the hallway (of which were still there the next morning on my way out!). ALL the vending machines were out of order. The sink in my room “whistled” when it ran. The water pressure in the shower was similar to standing in front of an outdoor water mister. The bathroom/front entrance (circa 1970) looked like it was used in a few scenes from “the Party” with Peter Sellers. The 2012 bedding and mattress made up for some of the above shortfalls.
reviews.title: 70's throwback

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling through to Nova Scotia or to catch the ferry to Newfoundland. Our room was spacious, very comfortable and the bed to just excellent. We also ate at the restaurant, the food was very good and the staff very friendly.
reviews.title: Travelling from Ontario to Newfoundland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed here several times. They are upgrading gradually. New TV this time and better (card) keys. Reservation agent went out her way to give us a discount. No CAA/AAA rating - possibly because of the lack of triple locks on the doors (only double). Seems popular with conventions and teams. Restaurant has good roast beef and good draft beer. You do have to figure out how to get in and out from the back of the Regent Mall if you are coming or going on the wrong side of Regent Street.
reviews.title: reliable and affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Did not have breakfast in the morning so cannot comment on the food. It was close to the highway and close to a number of restaurants.The restaurant in the hotel itself had a quite a few things on the menu and the prices seemed reasonable.
reviews.title: Clean, Convenient, Close to restaurants.

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Inn several times now, most recently Sept. 4th-2012, and have always had great service during our time there, from the front desk, to the maids, the restaurant and evening bar personnel. The location is ideal, convenient to the shopping and resaturants and is on the main road to get downtown or around Fredericton and it's surrounding areas. The hotel and its rooms are clean and spotless, and has the added bonus of real comfortable beds. Love the suites but have also stayed in the other rooms and enjoyed them as well. There is a grandeur feeling all about the hotel, some people have called it dated, but we prefer the feel over the newer chain hotels. They seem all about the service and making sure our stay is pleasant, which we do not always find in out travels. Definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Fredericton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a one-night stay at the Fredericton Inn. We had one of the drive-up rooms and it was soooo convenient - no dragging your luggage down hallways or onto elevators. The room itself was very nicely decorated with nice features and it was very clean and spotless. Also, the front desk reception was great and we really appreciated guest services section "Jill" offering us a choice of a firm or soft bed. Nice touch you don't always get today. Another plus is the onsite restuarant where we had breakfast. The service was excellent and the breakfast was just right
reviews.title: Fredericton Inn - Great place to stay!

reviews.text: We would certainly stay here again - no hesitation.
reviews.title: Good for the price
